fields.description:
This could affect earlier releases...

When a user is removed, the attachments tied to the PersonalInformation object are not explicitly removed, so the files aren't removed from the attachments store on disk.
fields.summary: User profile attachments are not deleted when the user is removed

fields.description: When uploading a picture to a user profile, the attachment is actually accessed and stored twice. So... two versions of the exact same file are created.
fields.summary: User profile pictures are stored twice in the one upload

fields.description:
Currently when you delete a page you are moved to the browse space view. 

This doesn't make much sense as it assumes that the user is browsing a space rather than navigating through the home page and/or via a parent page. 

After you delete a page it makes more sense to redirect to the: (a) parent page by default or the (b) space home page (if no parent exists), rather than simply redirecting to a vague browse space view.

The current browse space redirection annoys the users I have discussed this with.
fields.summary: Redirect to parent page or space homepage after user deletes page

fields.description: Export a site, restore it, favourite spaces and pages are not restored.
fields.summary: Favourites (spaces and pages) are lost on site restore

Add option to exportSpace remote API to allow save to the backups folder
Add restoreSpace and restoreSite to remote API

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to delete individual versions of an attachment.  Currently when a file with the same name is attached to a page multiple times, the attachment is versioned, but a user can only delete *all* of the versions.  In some situations, it would be useful to delete some of the versions.
fields.summary: Allow deletion of individual version attachments

fields.description:
If you run these commands, you'll have a build failure:
tar -zxf confluence-2.1.4-source.tar.gz
cd confluence-2.1.4-source/confluence
maven war

The failures are for these jar files, and they make it impossible to build from source and install the new version:
atlassian-mail-1.3.14.jar

fields.description:
When a user restricts the view to a page he owns so that he is the only one to be allowed to see it, the administrators can still get access to this page if they know the URL or following a link from another page.
However, this page will not appear to the administrator in the Recently Updated nor from the Browse Space views.

This is inconsistent.
I would expect a system administrator to have all the permissions on any page of the system and a space administrator to have all permissions on the pages within his spaces.
fields.summary: The admin can get access to a restricted page but not list it in the Recently Updated nor from the Browse Space views

fields.description:
Adding Space to Favorites fails resulting in an error

Steps to recreate:

1. Click on the star sign provided across the Space to add to favorites
2. Error window opens up and fails to add space to favorites. This link does not work after that at all.

Refer the image attached. 

Please note that this is one of most desired features that people in our company wanted to use which would avoid them to scroll through the various spaces to get to the correct one. Please provide a fix to this ASAP. Thanks.
fields.summary: Adding Space to Favorites fails resulting in an error

fields.description:
When a page is moved the wiki updates links on other pages but does the following:

[PageA|SpaceKey:PageA]
becomes:
[PageA]

That sucks because if people are referencing PageA on other pages in other spaces by using the {include} macro - all of the links that got renamed by the wiki show up as red links (uncreated pages) on the including page.
fields.summary: Renaming a Page Updates Links on Other pages but gets rid of the SpaceKey Causing Pages that use the Include macro to Include that page to show Red Links for all the renamed page links

fields.description:
Not being able to structure text the way you want or are used in a word processor is a frustrating, especially for non-techies.  Indenting is standard formatting today, and viewing the source or comparing versions becomes almost unintelligible with dozens of special HTML spaces characters   .

Since there is no way to indent regular text, perhaps an easy solution would be to have a "structured indent", by simply using an "none" list-style-type.  It would look like this:

ul { list-style-type: none; }

quick reference:  http://www.htmldog.com/reference/cssproperties/list-style-type/

This would enable people to create nicely formatted indentations like in word processors.  Ideally, the Rich Text Editor would include a button for this.  More ideally, a window would pop up and you can select the list-style-type (upper-roman, lower-greek, circle, disc, none...).

The above would be great even if a generic "Indent" is added using css ---  tab1{margin-left:20px;} tab2{margin-left:40px})
fields.summary: Indent solution:  "ul {list-style-type: none}" for structured indent

fields.description: The download all enhancement CONF-3407 was nice.   On my first download all use, I was surprised that it had to be a zip file. Unless that is a browser limitation, I would prefer to have the option to download all unzipped.  I agree that in some cases zipped would be more appropriate.
fields.summary: Download all attachments - no zip

fields.description:
Hello,

I have a problem to get CONF-2.1.4 running. On startup an error appears in catalina.out (as described in the summary) when trying to drop some indexes in the MySQL database.

The first try said "connection refused" on the drop index command but I fixed this by granting all rights for the confluence user on the database: grant all on confluence.* to confluenceuser@localhost.localdomain identified by '...';

But then the error changed to "session is currently disconnected". Attached you can find a tgz file with the whole log directory  a lot of startups) and our server.xml (for the MySQL connector config).

Thanks and best regards,
Heiko
fields.summary: Error: session is currently disconnected when starting CONF-2.1.4

fields.summary: Browse groups throws ClassCastException if there are LDAP groups that have the same name as Confluence goups

fields.description: When saving a page in confluence using Internet Explorer, it is taking a couple of minutes.  The saving the same page using Firefox takes about one second.  I've noticed some issues regarding IE that relate to the encoding, but the encoding we have confluence set to is UTF-8.
fields.summary: The time it takes to SAVE a page in IE is noticeably longer than Firefox

fields.description:
When a user goes to a page and clicks on the info tab and selects from the list of operations > "COPY" a copy of the page is generate for the user to edit and save as a new page, however if the user selects "CANCEL" prior to saving the copied page they are returned to a blank page.  It seems like the cancel button should redirect them back to the info page where they originally selected the "COPY" option.

The blank page the user sees after clicking cancel has a URL similar to the following:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/docopypage.action?idOfPageToCopy=157258

The replication path is pretty simple for this issue, I was encountered the same problem on our internal confluence site as well as your Confluence site in the TEST Space.
fields.summary: Cancelling of the Copy page function returns users to a blank page

fields.description: Pls separate school types in advanced search, because there are a lot of different schools under the same name (for examle: Szent István Egyetem, Szent István Gimnázium). It doesn't help if someone writes the word "gimnázium" at the and, because this word appears at nearly everyones "középiskola" field.
fields.summary: separate school types in advanced search

fields.description:
To reproduce this problem you have to follow the following steps:

1) Create a page hierarchy with at least 3 levels: Page 1 > Page 2 > Page 3
2) Move Page 1 and all its children to another space AND to another parent page
3) Goto Page 3 for example

The path shown by the breadcrumb should be:
Dashboard > New Space Home > New Parent > Page 1 > Page 2 > Page 3
but is displays:
Dashboard > New Space Home  > Level 2 > New Parent > Level 3 
Whatever the page you are browsing below Page 1, the breadcrumb is weird.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs showing wrong path after page with children moved

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Using Safari, go to confluence.atlassian.com
2) Browse Space on the DOC space
3) Go to the News tab.

Expected: an orange RSS icon appears in the Safari toolbar
Actual: No icon appears.

The HTML for the autodiscovery is there, but it seems that it's not being picked up by Safari. It's possible that this is because we're not correctly escaping the &'s in the URL, so the  discovery <link> isn't valid XHTML?

Or it could be something else entirely.

fields.description:
We need to document the use of language packs in the user and configuration guides.

This would include:
* Installing language packs
* Setting the global language
* Setting a user language preference
fields.summary: Document the internationalisation/use of languages in the user guide

fields.description:
Various requests have been raised to reduce the inclination of the renderer to generate large red error messages when content can't be rendered properly.

This is usually useful, allowing the author to fix the problem. But sometimes, such as in a content management scenario, the error output should be less obvious to normal users.

This is an umbrella task to allow minimising of rendering error output in the page content.

Suggestions include:
- a tab for logging errors
- minimal error messages, perhaps a small icon with tooltip
fields.summary: Provide an option to minimise output of render errors

fields.description: It would be nice to have the help tips that appear on some pages localised to the current user/global default language
fields.summary: Add support for localisation of help tips sidebar

fields.description: If one sets the attachment permissions for users of a space to allow removal, then as far as I can tell, any user can delete and attachment and it is completely gone.  So the only way to recover the lost attachment is by restoring from a backup.  On the other hand, if one does not allow attachment removal, then a Creator of an attachment cannot remove that attachment, so it is permanently up unless the administrator removes it.  It would be convenient if there was an intermediate level, for which only the Creator and Space Administrator can permanently remove attachments.
fields.summary: Attachment permissions: allow creator additional control

fields.description:
Language packs can now be loaded by dropping the JAR in the WEB-INF/lib/ directory. However, uploading the same JAR through the "Manage Plugins" interface and switching to that language does not work. It seems that the ResourceBundle class (in the JDK) can't find the .properties files for the plugin.

I suspect this is a class-loading issue, and we will have to hack around so that the plugin class-loader is used instead of the default one.

WORKAROUND: Place language pack JARs in the WEB-INF/lib/ directory.
fields.summary: The resources of language packs are not recognised when uploaded through the plugin interface

fields.description:
Using normal wiki markup editor. It does not matter whether or not the html macro is enabled. To reproduce, try editing: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Bob+Swift Page contents: {html} Document Title

WELCOME TO MY HOME PAGE!


Hi there! If you are reading this then you have found my home page! Congratulations! I know it can be hard to find my pages, but I bet that you feel lucky now. Now that you are here, please take a look at my page of links to cool sites or sign my guest book

My wonderful poetry is available if you are REALLY bored. Why not give it a spin?

The Best Poetry I NEVER Wrote

  • 'There Once Was A Man From Nantucket' - Anonymous
  • 'Cool In Fur' - Harry B. Foot
  • And My All Time Fave:
    • 'A Toast To My Toaster' - Me!
Brought to you by the letter "H" and Joe Shmoe
W hen you are done looking through these masterpieces, I encourage you to visit my proud sponsor!!
ADVERTISEMENT Buy Navel Lint Contemplator! Its a browser and its a sandwich spread! Go to our home page without delay! Why? Because shelf life is only 8 hours unless refrigerated. We know that makes it hard to browse, but it promotes frequent upgrading to the latest and greatest version.
All standard disclaimers apply. Your life depends on NOT copying this document in any way. This tape will self destruct in 10 seconds...
{html}
fields.summary: Unable to edit page with html markup

fields.description:
The headings notation 'hn.'  are only renderred in different font size, which would be vague sometimes in a complex content. The Cascade Outline Numbers of Heading make content clearer.  A new wiki notation should be introduced, such as 'h#n.', in order to render a cascade number. Moreover, while displaying  a page included other pages, the cascade numbers in the included pages are adjusted automatedly.

for examples

h#1. Heading-1
h#2. Heading-2
h#2. Heading-3
h#1. Heading-4

to be renderred:

1. Heading-1
1.1. Heading-2
1.2. Heading-3
2. Heading-4
fields.summary: Cascade Outline Number of Headings

fields.description:
It would be great to have a theme as a mixture of Plain Website Theme and Left Navigation Theme. Left Navigation feature is very usefull but when we use that theme we also have lots of operational stuff on the site which anonymous users do not want to see (in fact it's more that we do not want them to see). So it would be really great to combine these two themes.

I'll also look at theme writing at developer corner but it would be better if we can get a standard one from Atlassian.
fields.summary: Need for a new theme which is a mixture of Plain Website Theme and Left Navigation Theme

fields.description: When I edit a page whose permissions are set to ro/wo for other scan the changes appearing in the feeds via the feedbuilder; ie feeds don't seem to honor page level permissions. I understand this might be tricky to implement (per user/group filtering on the feed), but rss permissions should be consistent with the permissions. use cases are where pages are zoned off for particular org groups or individuals, or where customers have limited access into a space.
fields.summary: RSS feeds don't honour page permissions?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5467].
  {panel}

Looks like error handling changed for images around 2.x.  If an image attachment was not found, it use to just show an missing image box.  Now it shows a red error message.  This looks ugly if you were using the missing image as a place holder.  We have just migrated a bunch of pages that use to look fine with missing images and now look ugly.  For things like this and other similar cases, error handling could be improved.  On one hand you want to show the author problems when they are creating or modifying a page.  On the other hand, we don't want end users who look at pages to see ugly error messages.   Have you considered other options for error handling?
> 1) mouse over text showing error text ?
> 2) separate info area that shows error details ?
> 3) error tab ?
Generally speaking, errors that are not that critical and may be left in the text on purpose should present in a way that is ok to look at.  For example, red highlighted area (but no error message).  I think there are examples of this today.

Page comparison should indicate name changes

fields.description: The group picker used to add groups to space permissions shows first 49 groups and then doesn't allow to page through the rest of the groups. Combined with the case sensitivity of the filter (see CONF-5463) this makes it rather hard to add groups to the permissions in large installations.
fields.summary: Group Picker only shows first 49 groups with no option for paging

fields.description:
The group filtering in Confluence's administration interfaces is case sensitive, similar to JRA-9072.

For example, if you edit space permissions, the picker that allows filtering for groups uses case sensitive filtering. Obviously this shouldn't be the case.
fields.summary: Group filtering is case sensitive

fields.description: If I click on a label in the list generated by {listlabels:myspace}, I'd expect to get a list of all pages with the selected label *in this space* (/label/myspace/foo). Instead I get a list of all pages in all spaces with the selected label (/label/foo).
fields.summary: {listlabels} macro always links to global label pages

fields.description:
I guess we are not the only shop using confluence for documentation... There are things that can very well be explained with a little diagramm or chart, but cannot be described in words very good.

It would be great if one could draw small diagrams inside of confluence. 

At the moment one would have to draw in applications like Visio or PowerPoint, then export this as a graphic and import that into confluence. As a result the graphic is always outdated or not even created because the author does not like to switch environments.

This probably requires a huge tuneup of the WYSIWYG editor. Personally I would prefer Diagrams to be handled as "objects" inside of a page, that are edited by a separate editor from the page editor. In the page sourcecode would just be a reference to the object.
fields.summary: Draw charts and diagrams in Confluence

fields.description:
I've been upgrading confluence versions for a while now and didn't catch this permission error in the last round.  As it stands (see graphic-attachment) there is anonymous access to the space but no users or groups, thusly no administrator.  I'm triggering the fail-safe that should not allow the editing of perms in a space to null admin rights, but since I  have somehow gone beyond it, it's acting as a trap keeping me from modifying the perms.  I am the confluence administrator.

Somehow I need to push some user/admin into the group underneath the ui or theres a way around the ui within the ui.

Some guidence is appreciated,

-a

When I enter some unicode on to a page it seems to work fine, for a while.  Subsequent views and edits show the unicode still happily displaying various characters.  Then, after a day or so (it could be less, I'm not sure), the characters suddenly revert to ????? etc.

Example URL showing page with this problem:

http://www.adaptavist.com/display/USERGUIDE/Customising+the+View+and+Edit+Menus

There is an image for MSIE users so they can see what the menu mods should look like and then the unicode appears further down - or rather it would if it hadn't been mysteriously replaced by ?????

It seems that something is affecting the content post-edit and I can't work out where or what. :(

Here's the Unicode (I wonder if the same happens in JIRA?):

眺め

and

このページ
fields.summary: Unicode characters in page content seem fine for a while, then they rever to ?????

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5436].
  {panel}

A customer was complaining about the error message that appears in Confluence if the user does not have permissions to view the content included via an include. As such:

# Can we please add a flag to the include macro so that the error message can be turned off so that the page will render seamlessly (with no error messages) regardless of the include existing and the viewers permissions.

*Alternative Simple Solution*
# Can Confluence can handle this warning with a more friendly message  (e.g. You do not have permission to view this page.)

We also  need to make note of this in the Confluence documentation - in the user guide I'd suggest.
fields.summary: Add capability to turn off include error message and make note of this in Conf user guide/admin guide docs

You could say this is a feature request, but it's such a glaring omission I would consider it a bug.

You need to be able to remove users from Confluence. Huge problem for companies that cannot remove previous employees from the system (and thus are wasting licensed user counts).

fields.description:
There is no method to check if a permission is set in a space to a specific user.
A method like this would solve my problem:
boolean Vector getSpacePermissions(String token, String permission, String remoteEntityName, String spaceKey)

fields.description:
The WYSIWYG editor incorrectly escapes URLs in links:

For example, http://localhost/index.html?a=b&c=d becomes http://localhost/index.html?a=b&&&c=d

The obviously breaks the hyperlink.

A lot of our pages have links in them with GET parameters hence this means that our users cannot use the WYSIWYG editor to edit their pages, or if they do the page ends up broken.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor incorrectly escapes ampersands in URLs

fields.description: We would like to use dashes in titles. Is there a chance to let some mark-up working in titles? Various inline markup would be nice (emoticons, ;-)) but at least both dashes should work, because - is not good enough dash. Formating markup would not be good I think.
fields.summary: Dashes in titles

fields.description:
I was just talking to a partner and they were unable to view the Demonstration Space. This was incredibly surprising given that anonymous users had the view permission! That makes no sense for 99% of use cases.

We need to ensure that any permissions that the anonymous user group has are inherited by the other groups. I can't see a use case where this would not be the case.

Given the possibility of other use cases that we have not forseen, it would be ideal if by default any anonymous user permissions were inherited but the automatic inheritance of anonymous permissions could be turned on and off.
fields.summary: Anonymous access permissions are not inherited - logged in users don't even share anonymous access privelages
